item.title: Report X-2025061835
item.description:
Report X-2025061835

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Ops Sup advised that a trailer arrived to 120 and a pallet of freight appears to have arrived damaged. Freight on the bottom of the pallet appeared to be crushed and the pallet was leaning. The operations supervisor advised that at least one pail was crushed and released onto the trailer floor and that the release leaked through to the yard. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025061834
item.description:
Report X-2025061834

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A trailer was found leaking on the yard and was moved to the dock. The trailer was unloaded and it was determined that something evaporative had leaked but there were multiple pails and drums, and multiple UN numbers for the pro that was loaded onto the trailer. There did not appear to be anything visible on the yard and what spilled on the trailer soaked into the trailer floor leaving a stain. The operations supervisor advised something may have sloshed out of the top of one of the pails in transit but none of them appear to be leaking now. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation and to determine what spilled and if the yard will need to be power washed.~~Called CURA and spoke with Juliana who advised a crew would attempt to determine what spilled and inspect the freight and will also inspect the yard and power wash if needed.~~CURA advised that 1 pail of UN1294 was punctured by a nail and full released into the trailer and onto the pavement below the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2025070465
item.description:
Report X-2025070465

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-28
  • City: FORT WINGATE ARMY DEPOT
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FRA Inspector found UTLX 673138 with dry product residue around the bottom outlet valve. No ground contact. No waterways or sewers impacted. BNSF Hazmat (J. Hankins) responded to car and found some dried product around BOV nozzle. Cap was less than tool-tight. Valve was closed. Upon removing cap a small amount of liquid was noted inside cap and no visible leakage occurring past the ball valve. Gasket looked to be in good shape, but was replaced with a new gasket. Cap was replaced and tool-tightened.
